quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 2 Quiz 6
quiz.subtitle: 2.6: Even and Odd Functions
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Algebraic and graphical classification of symmetry

questions.question: Which of the following describes an even function?
questions.explanation: Even functions yield the same output when the input is negated, mirroring across the y-axis.

questions.question: A function has origin symmetry. This function is classified as:
questions.explanation: Origin symmetry is the defining graphical characteristic of odd functions.

questions.question: Determine if $f(x) = x^4 - 3x^2 + 5$ is even, odd, or neither.
questions.explanation: Every exponent is even (4, 2, and 0 for the constant term). $f(-x) = (-x)^4 - 3(-x)^2 + 5 = x^4 - 3x^2 + 5$.

questions.question: What is the classification of $h(x) = x^2 + x$?
questions.explanation: Because it contains both an even exponent (2) and an odd exponent (1), it will not satisfy the conditions for even or odd symmetry.

questions.question: Which parent function is an odd function?
questions.explanation: The reciprocal function $1/x$ has origin symmetry: $1/(-x) = -(1/x)$.

questions.question: If $f$ is an even function and $f(3) = 10$, what is $f(-3)$?
questions.explanation: For even functions, $f(-x)$ is the same as $f(x)$.

questions.question: If $g$ is an odd function and $g(5) = -2$, what is $g(-5)$?
The constant function $f(x) = 0$ is considered:
questions.explanation: Since $0 = -0$, it satisfies both $f(-x) = f(x)$ and $f(-x) = -f(x)$.

questions.question: Geometrically, an odd function remains unchanged after a rotation of:
questions.explanation: Origin symmetry is equivalent to a half-turn (180 degrees) around the center point.

scoreMessages.90: Spot on! You can identify symmetry in your sleep.
scoreMessages.70: Good work. Remember that constant terms have an invisible $x^0$, making them even.
scoreMessages.50: Test your functions by plugging in $-x$ and simplifying carefully.
scoreMessages.0: Review the algebraic definitions of even and odd functions.
